name: Jelena Marasevic
content: Jelena Diakonikolas HOME ABOUT NEWS CONTACT Jelena Diakonikolas I am an Assistant Professor at the Department of Computer Sciences and (by courtesy) the Department of Statistics, at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. I am also an affiliate of the Data Science Institute at UW-Madison. My main research interests are in the area of large-scale optimization. I am also interested in applications of optimization methods, particularly within machine learning. Prior to joining UW-Madison, I was a Postdoctoral Fellow at UC Berkeley's Foundations of Data Analysis (FODA) TRIPODS Institute, where I primarily worked with Mike Jordan. In Fall 2018, I was a Microsoft Research Fellow at the Simons Institute for the Theory of Computing, associated with the program on Foundations of Data Science. Prior to starting the postdoctoral position at UC Berkeley, I was a Postdoctoral Associate at the Department of Computer Science, Boston University, where I worked with Lorenzo Orecchia. I completed my Ph.D. at the Department of Electrical Engineering, Columbia University, where I was co-advised by Gil Zussman and Cliff Stein. Some of my publications are under my maiden name -- MaraÅ¡eviÄ. Prospective students: I am receiving a large volume of email and cannot respond to individual requests. All of the graduate students in the CS program at UW-Madison are admitted by the department, not by individual faculty. Thus, I can only respond to requests from students who are already admitted to UW-Madison. I am an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Sciences and (by courtesy) the Department of Statistics at UW-Madison. I am also an affiliate of the Data Science Institute at UW-Madison. My full CV can be found here. My maiden name is MaraÅ¡eviÄ. Research Interests First-order convex and non-convex optimization algorithms; momentum-based methods Variational inequalities and fixed-point iterations Optimization in learning applications; Width-independent algorithms (optimization on a relative scale) Lower bounds in optimization Selected Honors & Awards Google ML & Systems Junior Faculty Award (2025) NSF CAREER Award (2025) AFOSR Young Investigator Program award (2024) UW-Madison Provost's Award for Mentoring Undergraduates In Research, Scholarly, and Creative Activities (2023) Simons-Berkeley Research Fellowship and Microsoft Research Fellowship (2018) Morton B. Friedman Memorial Prize for Excellence at Columbia Engineering (2017) Columbia EE Dept. Collaborative Research Award (2017) Qualcomm Innovation Fellowship (2015) MIT EECS Rising Star (2015) Jacob Millman Award (Outstanding TA) (2013) Columbia University M.S. Award of Excellence (2013) Professional Activities I am on the scientific committee of ELLIIT Symposium on Optimization for Learning, to be held as part of ELLIIT Focus Periods, in Lund, Sweden, in May 2026. I am on the program committee of the INFORMS Optimization Society conference 2026, as an Optimization in Data Science track co-chair. [conference website] I am a cluster chair for ICCOPT 2025, for the cluster on "Fixed Points and Variational Inequalities". [conference website] I am on the organizing committee of the OPT 2024 workshop @ NeurIPS 2024 [workshop website]. I was on the program committee of the INFORMS Optimization Society conference 2024, as an Optimization in Data Science track co-chair. [conference website] Co-organized a mini symposium on Advances in First-Order Primal-Dual Methods at SIAM OP 23. [mini symposium program Part 1 out of 4] Co-organized the NeurIPS Workshop Order Up! The Benefits of Higher-Order Optimization in Machine Learning. [workshop website] Co-organizing the WISCERS exploreCSR program: a research mentorship program for undergraduate students, intended to increase research participation of historically underrepresented groups in computing. [program website] Co-organized the Workshop on Sampling Algorithms and Geometries on Probability Distributions at the Simons Institute, as part of the Geometric Methods in Optimization and Sampling Fall 2021 program. [workshop website] Co-organized the Conference on Optimization, as part of the Focus Program on Data Science and Optimization at the Fields Institute, in November 2019. [workshop website] Organized the INFORMS session on the Continuous-time Perspective in Optimization in 2019. Conference program committees: STOC'26 (PC Member), NeurIPS'25 (Area Chair and Workshop PC), COLT'25 (senior PC member), ICLR'25 (Area Chair), NeurIPS'24 (Workshop PC), FOCS'24 (PC Member), SODA'24 (PC Member), COLT'24 (senior PC member), ICML'24 (Area Chair), ICLR'24 (Area Chair), ITCS'24 (PC Member), NeurIPS'23 (Workshop PC), COLT'23 (senior PC member), ICML'23 (Area Chair), COLT'22 (senior PC member), ICLR'22 (Area Chair), NeurIPS'21 (Area Chair), ICML'21 (Workshop PC), ICLR'21 (Area Chair), ICML'20 (Area Chair), ICALP'20 (PC member), ICNP'18 (PC member), NETGCOOP'18 (PC member).
